page.title: 06ST.DUNSTANS HOSPITAL
page.content: St. Dunstans hospital was founded in 1915 by Sir Arthur Pearson, his objective being to establish a {rehabilitation centre}for men{blinded in World War 1. The original situation in Regents Park, London, was very successful but there was an overflow; thus in 1930 with the threat of another war looming an annexe was built in{Ovingdean.} Ian Fraser house is a six storey building on high ground overlooking the sea. The floor plans are all identical, with many guide rails, creating an ideal habitat for the blind occupants. The general facilities are varied and plentiful and include workshops, bowling rinks, gymnasium, swimming pool and even archery on the lawns. The main task is for the staff to develop the patients' skills to get them back into society.
